result.execSummary:
The defendant Raquan M Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Psilocin(<=100g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(g)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant from clerk with Judge's response.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by the defendant with Judge Reilly's response.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by the defendant.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed by Atty. Govin.

9:11 AM; Case called for Sentencing hearing. Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Raquan M Thompson in court.  Attorney Stephen Michael Govin in court for Raquan M Thompson.  Court reviews the case on the record and confirms with counsel parties are prepared to proceed with sentencing.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Govin.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 3:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

4 Years Imprisonment (1 Day Credit IF revoked)
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program IF revoked.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program IF revoked.

Term of Probation:  36 Months (Court will allow transfer to the County in which the defendant currently resides).

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision (IF revoked):
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription
-	No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed;
-	Make best efforts to Maintain/Obtain full time employment, schooling or a combination of the two.

Condition Time: 30 Days Huber with release for employment and school - Defendant to report to the facility by 6:00 p.m. on 09/09/2022. (Court will allow transfer to the County in which the defendant currently resides).

COSTS:  $268.00;

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Documents and Letters in Support of Defendant for sentencing filed by Atty. Govin.
Sentencing hearing on August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

9:44 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Raquan M Thompson in court.  Attorney Stephen Michael Govin in court for Raquan M Thompson. Court notes it has received a plea questionnaire and recites the offer as listed on the questionnaire.  State just wants to clarify the reason for defense requesting a new sentencing date, noting the defendant needs time to pay upfront costs. Atty. Govin confirms.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 3.  Court orders Counts 1, 2, 4 & 5 dismissed and read in.  Court will adjourn for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:59 AM Defendant Raquan M Thompson in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kicheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel made comments regarding resolution and progess of negotiations.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Govin is still reviewing discovery and requests a new date to advise the court how case is proceeding.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
